metadata.title: USN-6719-1 -- util-linux vulnerability
metadata.description: Skyler Ferrante discovered that the util-linux wall command did not filter escape sequences from command line arguments. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6719-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  bsdutils - 1:2.39.1-4ubuntu2.1 No subscription required  util-linux-locales - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2.1 libmount1 - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2.1 util-linux - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2.1 rfkill - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2.1 libmount-dev - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2.1 eject - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2.1 libfdisk1 - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2.1 libsmartcols1 - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2.1 mount - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2.1 bsdextrautils - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2.1 libfdisk-dev - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2.1 util-linux-extra - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2.1 libsmartcols-dev - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2.1 uuid-dev - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2.1 libblkid-dev - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2.1 fdisk - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2.1 uuid-runtime - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2.1 libblkid1 - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2.1 libuuid1 - 2.39.1-4ubuntu2.1 No subscription required
